page.title: 14Warwickshire Railway Line
page.content: The Warwickshire line was built by the Great Westen Railway in 1908 as a{Main {Line.}It was an express line from the Midlands to Bristol and the holiday resorts of Cornwall and Devon.Today it only takes people from Stratford on Avon to Birmingham (Moor St) as a lot of the main line has been removed. This remaining section is now under threat of closure but this is being strongly opposed by an action group. { {The Railway Museum }at Tyseley, in Birmingham, has Steam days when Steam trains run from Tyseley to Stratford every three hours. Many people go to watch. { {The Gloucestershire}and{Warwickshire {Railway Society based}at Toddington would like to re_open the whole line from Gloucester to Stratford.
